value: Let's dive in with a code sample

What does the following code print?:
if 4 + 5 == 10:
 print('TRUE')
else:
 print('FALSE')
print('TRUE')

correct.value: Since 4+5==10 will be False, else block would be executed and since last statement if neither in if block nor in else block, it will always be executed.

incorrect.value: Since 4+5==10 will be False, else block would be executed and since last statement if neither in if block nor in else block, it will always be executed.
